intro: Draba aizoides subsp. estevei, commonly known as the Catalan rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It has a compact growth form with basal leaves and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features include hairy stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring.
